required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Outcomes and Gingival Blood Flow Using Laser Doppler Flowmetry Following the Use of Episil on Free Gingival Graft Donor Sites
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial Pilot Study: Patient Outcomes and Gingival Blood Flow Using Laser Doppler Flowmetry Following the Use of Episil on Free Gingival Graft Donor Sites

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis for the present study is that patient-based outcomes and gingival blood flow will be more favorable for the free gingival graft (FGG) donor sites being covered by the test wound dressing material episil compared to the control dressing.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by Number of Participants With a Score of 0-3 (no to Minimal Pain) on a Visual Analog Scale
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording their postoperative pain threshold using a Visual Analog Scale with scores from 1 to 10, with 1 indicating minimal pain and 10 indicating severe pain. If no pain is present, a score of 0 will be given. The levels of postoperative pain will be classified as none to minimum if the score is "0 to 3," moderate for "4 to 6," and severe for "7 to 10." None to minimal pain will mean little or no discomfort; moderate is any pain that bothers the subject and mildly affects normal function; and severe will be considered any pain that will not be tolerated and may even disrupt the subject's daily functions.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills (Ibuprofen 600mg tablets) taken each day.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills (Ibuprofen 600mg tablets) taken each day.

primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills (Ibuprofen 600mg tablets) taken each day.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills taken each day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flometry (LDF)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline (on the day of surgery before surgery)
secondary_outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the free gingival graft (FGG) donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)
secondary_outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the FGG donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)
secondary_outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the FGG donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)
secondary_outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the FGG donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)
secondary_outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the FGG donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Re-epithelialization of the FGG Donor Site as Indicated by a Non-invasive Peroxide Test
secondary_outcome.description: The non-invasive peroxide test is based on the principle that if the epithelium is discontinuous, the H2O2 diffuses into the connective tissue; the enzyme catalase acts on H2O2 to release water and oxygen: this is clinically shown by the production of bubbles on the wound. 3% H2O2 will be applied to the FGG donor site with a syringe and the appearance of bubbles will be recorded as a dichotomous variable (yes/no).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Re-epithelialization of the FGG Donor Site as Indicated by a Non-invasive Peroxide Test
secondary_outcome.description: The non-invasive peroxide test is based on the principle that if the epithelium is discontinuous, the H2O2 diffuses into the connective tissue; the enzyme catalase acts on H2O2 to release water and oxygen: this is clinically shown by the production of bubbles on the wound. 3% H2O2 will be applied to the FGG donor site with a syringe and the appearance of bubbles will be recorded as a dichotomous variable (yes/no).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Re-epithelialization of the FGG Donor Site as Indicated by a Non-invasive Peroxide Test
secondary_outcome.description: The non-invasive peroxide test is based on the principle that if the epithelium is discontinuous, the H2O2 diffuses into the connective tissue; the enzyme catalase acts on H2O2 to release water and oxygen: this is clinically shown by the production of bubbles on the wound. 3% H2O2 will be applied to the FGG donor site with a syringe and the appearance of bubbles will be recorded as a dichotomous variable (yes/no).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Re-epithelialization of the FGG Donor Site as Indicated by a Non-invasive Peroxide Test
secondary_outcome.description: The non-invasive peroxide test is based on the principle that if the epithelium is discontinuous, the H2O2 diffuses into the connective tissue; the enzyme catalase acts on H2O2 to release water and oxygen: this is clinically shown by the production of bubbles on the wound. 3% H2O2 will be applied to the FGG donor site with a syringe and the appearance of bubbles will be recorded as a dichotomous variable (yes/no).

arm_group.description: Episil is a wound dressing material intended for the management of pain and relief of pain by adhering to the mucosal surface of the mouth, soothing oral lesions of various etiologies. episil is an oromucosal liquid that transforms in situ to a bioadhesive oromucosal gel by uptake of small amounts of aqueous fluid.
PeriAcryl90 is a cyanoacrylate wound dressing.

intervention.description: Episil is a wound dressing material intended for the management of pain and relief of pain by adhering to the mucosal surface of the mouth, soothing oral lesions of various etiologies. episil is an oromucosal liquid that transforms in situ to a bioadhesive oromucosal gel by uptake of small amounts of aqueous fluid.
PeriAcryl90 is a cyanoacrylate wound dressing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient of record at UTHealth School of Dentistry Houston Texas
- signed treatment plan for a FGG
- the ability to provide research informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- any allergies to any of the ingredients in episil including allergies to peanuts, soy or peppermint oil
- smokers
- pregnant or breast feeding women
- inability or unwillingness to provide informed consent

measure.title: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
measure.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills (Ibuprofen 600mg tablets) taken each day.

outcome.title: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
outcome.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills (Ibuprofen 600mg tablets) taken each day.

group.title: Episil Wound Dressing
group.description: Episil is a wound dressing material intended for the management of pain and relief of pain by adhering to the mucosal surface of the mouth, soothing oral lesions of various etiologies. episil is an oromucosal liquid that transforms in situ to a bioadhesive oromucosal gel by uptake of small amounts of aqueous fluid.

group.title: PeriAcryl90 Wound Dressing
group.description: PeriAcryl90 is a cyanoacrylate wound dressing.

measure.title: Postoperative Pain as Assessed by the Number of Analgesic Pills Taken Each Day
measure.description: Postoperative pain will be determined by the subjects recording the number of analgesic pills taken each day.

outcome.title: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flometry (LDF)
outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the free gingival graft (FGG) donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.
outcome.time_frame: baseline (on the day of surgery before surgery)

group.title: Episil Wound Dressing
group.description: Episil is a wound dressing material intended for the management of pain and relief of pain by adhering to the mucosal surface of the mouth, soothing oral lesions of various etiologies. episil is an oromucosal liquid that transforms in situ to a bioadhesive oromucosal gel by uptake of small amounts of aqueous fluid.

group.title: PeriAcryl90 Wound Dressing
group.description: PeriAcryl90 is a cyanoacrylate wound dressing.

measure.title: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flometry (LDF)
measure.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the free gingival graft (FGG) donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.

outcome.title: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)
outcome.description: The laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) technique to measure the blood perfusion of the FGG donor site. The value reported is blood flow at the FGG donor site (operated site) minus blood flow at the contralateral side of the palate (non-operated site). Perfusion Units (PU) are reported, which is blood flow through a given volume or mass of tissue with the unit of measure mL/100g/min.
outcome.population: One patient was not able to have Day 3 laser Doppler flowmetry (LDF) readings because of a death in the family, and this patient had to travel out of town for several days.

measure.title: Gingival Blood Flow as Measured Laser Doppler Flowmetry (LDF)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Re-epithelialization of the FGG Donor Site as Indicated by a Non-invasive Peroxide Test
outcome.description: The non-invasive peroxide test is based on the principle that if the epithelium is discontinuous, the H2O2 diffuses into the connective tissue; the enzyme catalase acts on H2O2 to release water and oxygen: this is clinically shown by the production of bubbles on the wound. 3% H2O2 will be applied to the FGG donor site with a syringe and the appearance of bubbles will be recorded as a dichotomous variable (yes/no).

group.title: Episil Wound Dressing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
